description: Numbers n for which sigma(n^2) is prime.
comments: sigma(n) is the sum of the divisors of n (A000203).If sigma(x) is prime, then x=2 or x=p^(2m), an even power of a prime, cf. A023194. This sequence lists the values n = p^m such that sigma(n^2) is prime, i.e., sqrt( A023194 \ {2} ). The corresponding primes sigma(n^2)=A062700(n) are 1+p+...+p^(2m) = (p^(2m+1)-1)/(p-1), and any prime of that form (cf. A023195) corresponds to a term p^m is in this sequence. - _M. F. Hasler_, Oct 14 2014This is a subsequence of A000961, see A248963 for its complement therein. - _M. F. Hasler_, Oct 19 2014
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..4730
prog: (PARI) for(n=1,9999,isprime(sigma(n^2))&&print1(n",")) \\ _M. F. Hasler_, Oct 18 2014(MAGMA) [n: n in [1..2000] | IsPrime(SumOfDivisors(n^2))]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Oct 18 2014
crossrefs: Cf. A023195 (primes of the form sigma(n)), A062700 (in order of appearance).
author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jun 07 2000
extensions: Minor edits by _M. F. Hasler_, Oct 18 2014
